conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation affected by light source position.
Three objects casting shadows labeled A, B, and C on the ground.
Object A is a birdcage, object B is a cup, and object C is a piece of meat.
Light source positioned such that shadows are cast to the left of the objects.
Shadows will move in the opposite direction of the light source movement.
Shadows will shift to the left as the light source moves to the right.
Shadows A, B, and C will move to the left relative to their current positions.
Extent of shadow shift depends on distance light source moves and height above objects.
Size of shadows changes based on angle of light source.
If light source moves horizontally without height change, shadow size may not change significantly.
If light source lowers height, shadows become larger.
If light source raises height, shadows become smaller.
Shadow A will move left and may elongate slightly depending on light source height change.
Shadow B will move left and may change shape slightly due to object's geometry.
Shadow C will move left and may become more elongated or compressed depending on light source height.
Shadows A, B, and C will shift to the left on the ground when light source moves right.
Shadow size may change depending on light source height; decrease leads to larger shadows, increase leads to smaller shadows.
Exact change in size and shape depends on specific movement and height of light source relative to objects.
